intro: Hieraciodes prenanthodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Cariandraceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, narrow leaves arranged in a rosette pattern, and its flowers are typically white or pale pink, appearing in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
